label: system-design
title: System Design
description: This blog post provides an in-depth exploration of system design, covering key concepts such as scalability, reliability, and maintainability. It discusses the principles and best practices for designing robust software systems, with a focus on real-world applications.
author: Avinash Gurugubelli

children.label: 01-general
children.title: General System Design Principles
children.description: This blog post introduces the fundamental principles of system design, focusing on scalability, reliability, and maintainability. It provides an overview of key concepts and best practices for designing robust software systems.
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli

children.label: 01-0-graph-db-vs-triple-store-notes.md
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli
children.title: Applications of Property Graphs vs Triple Stores (RDF)
children.description: A comparative analysis of applications for Property Graphs and Triple Stores (RDF), highlighting their strengths in various domains.

children.label: 02-0-graph-query-examples.md
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli
children.title: Sample Query Comparison: SQL, CQL (Cypher), SPARQL
children.description: A comparative analysis of SQL, CQL (Cypher), and SPARQL queries for a common graph query problem.

children.label: 02-1-horizontal-scaling-practice.md
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli
children.title: Horizontal Scaling Practice Guide
children.description: A practical guide to horizontal scaling with hands-on examples using Node.js, MongoDB, Kafka, and Redis.

children.label: 03-0-storage-and-retrival.md
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli
children.title: Storage and Retrieval
children.description: A comprehensive guide to storage and retrieval systems, covering indexing structures, transaction processing, and data warehousing.

children.label: 03-1-column-storage-summary.md
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli
children.title: Column-Oriented Storage Summary
children.description: A concise summary of column-oriented storage, its advantages, and how it works with examples.

children.label: 04-encoding-and-evolution
children.title: Encoding and Evolution
children.description: This blog post explores the concepts of data encoding and schema evolution in software systems. It discusses how data formats can change over time and the implications for backward and forward compatibility in applications.
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli

children.label: 04-0-encoding-and-evolution.md
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli
children.title: Encoding and Evolution
children.description: A comprehensive guide to data encoding formats, their evolution, and practical examples in Node.js.

children.label: 04-1-message-packExamples-in-javascript.md
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli
children.title: MessagePack Examples in JavaScript
children.description: A practical example of using MessagePack for encoding data in JavaScript, comparing it with JSON.

children.label: 04-2-serialization-comparison.md
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli
children.title: Serialization Format Comparison
children.description: A detailed comparison of various serialization formats including JSON, MessagePack, Thrift, and Protobuf.

children.label: 04-3-serialization-comparison-avro.md
children.author: Avinash Gurugubelli
children.title: Serialization Comparison: Avro
children.description: A detailed comparison of Avro serialization format with examples and explanations.
